entry.title: overall bitcoin client code quality
entry.summary: A discussion thread between Bitcoin developers centered around some technical issues and proposals for improving the Bitcoin code base. One proposal was to move towards 'libbitcoin', and there was a suggestion to create a branch and start libbtc by implementing a small module like IRC or P2P connection handling. Another topic discussed was the hardcoded values for official and testnet blockchains, with some developers supporting the idea of moving all chain-related settings to a chain description file to allow custom chains and clean up the code. However, others were against this idea, saying that alternate chains should be designed to share the main chain's difficulty. There was also a debate about transaction fees and their purpose, with some suggesting that they should be easily changeable while others argued that they serve an important function and need to be rethought and recoded. Finally, one developer suggested rewriting the Bitcoin codebase to make it more feature-rich and secure, though another developer pointed out that trying to fix bugs on an old codebase while rewriting a new one is unnecessary.
